scheme_name: Vidyakiranam Scheme - Educational Assistance To Children Of Disabled Parents
description: The Vidyakiranam Scheme in Kerala provides educational assistance to the children of disabled parents to support their education from primary to higher secondary levels. The scheme aims to reduce financial barriers and promote education for these children.
key_features: Financial support for children of disabled parents
Covers primary to higher secondary education
Implemented by the Kerala Social Security Mission

benefits.assistance_amount: Varies based on educational level and state guidelines
benefits.coverage: School fees, books, uniforms, and other expenses

education_criteria: Children enrolled in primary, secondary, or higher secondary classes
Must be studying in recognized schools
additional_criteria: Parent must have a disability as certified by a medical board
Must be a resident of Kerala
Annual family income must not exceed state-specified limit
institution_criteria: Government or recognized private schools in Kerala

steps: Obtain application form from the Kerala Social Security Mission or local authorities
application_process.note: Contact the mission for application details

required_documents.note: For parent, issued by medical board

special_notes: Limited to children of disabled parents
Assistance amount varies based on educational level
Renewal requires proof of continued enrollment
